voice_instruct: A commanding, intellectually precise woman's voice with regal authority and cold beauty, measured cadence like a scholar delivering a thesis that could overthrow kingdoms

tracks.title: The Heretic Queen
tracks.prompt: orchestral electronic, commanding female vocals, strings and analog synths, precise percussion, Bjork Homogenic meets Fever Ray, D minor, 74 BPM, intellectual authority, cold fire
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
they call me heretic in the corridors of Kharbranth
they whisper atheist like it is a disease, a slant
against the Almighty, against the Vorin church's hold
but I have walked in Shadesmar and I know what I was told

Honor is dead, that is not heresy, that is fact
the god they worship shattered millennia back
and the priests who sell his name are selling smoke and prayer
to a throne that has no occupant, to an empty chair

[chorus]
call me heretic, I have earned the name
call me dangerous, it is not a claim I disclaim
the truth is not a kindness, the truth is not polite
the truth is what remains when you strip away the night

[verse 2]
I soulcast a man to smoke in a dark alley in Kharbranth
four thieves who followed me thinking I was easy, a savant
with too much jewelry and not enough sense to run
I turned them to fire and crystal, one by one

Kaladin calls it murder, I call it applied philosophy
if four men choose to attack a woman walking free
the consequence is theirs, the choice was made, the line was crossed
I do not mourn the wolves, I count the sheep they would have lost

[bridge]
Ivory bonds me, a high spren, an inkspren of the mind
he crossed into the Physical when no other spren would bind
to a woman who denies the gods and questions every creed
because the truest oath is the one spoken from need

[chorus]
call me heretic, I have earned the name
call me dangerous, it is not a claim I disclaim
the truth is not a kindness, the truth is not polite
the truth is what remains when you strip away the night

tracks.title: Shadesmar
tracks.prompt: dark ambient electronic, commanding female vocals, crystalline synths, deep sub-bass, Massive Attack meets Fever Ray, Ab minor, 68 BPM, alien ocean, inverted sky of glass beads
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I fell into Shadesmar when the assassins burned the ship
Gavilar's allies cutting loose the last Kholin grip
and I sank through the ocean of glass beads, each one a soul
of every object in the Physical, each bead made whole

the Cognitive Realm inverts the sky, the ground is obsidian
the spren walk like people here, the cities are meridian
lines of thought made manifest, and I was stranded there
for months, surviving on soulcast food and Ivory's care

[chorus]
Shadesmar taught me what the scholars never could
that reality has layers and each layer is understood
by those willing to abandon every comfort they have known
and walk the other side of thought completely on their own

[verse 2]
I walked from the sea of beads to a spren city made of bronze
and I bargained with the inkspren, who are formal in their bonds
they debated whether humans should be helped or left to fall
and Ivory argued for me, the only one who argued at all

I soulcast my way across the realm, transforming air to food
transforming stone to stairs, transforming logic into good
and when I found the Perpendicularity, the path between the sides
I stepped back into the Physical carrying everything the Cognitive provides

[bridge]
most people fear Shadesmar, the alien, the reversed
but I found it clarifying, like a theorem rehearsed
strip away the physical, the body, the disguise
and what remains is the pattern of the mind behind the eyes

[chorus]
Shadesmar taught me what the scholars never could
that reality has layers and each layer is understood
by those willing to abandon every comfort they have known
and walk the other side of thought completely on their own

tracks.title: Soulcasting
tracks.prompt: precise electronic, commanding female vocals, mathematical rhythms, transformative synth textures, Autechre meets Bjork, E minor, 76 BPM, molecular persuasion, matter reimagined
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
every object has a soul, a bead in the Cognitive sea
and Soulcasting is the art of arguing it free
from what it is to what it could be, stone to smoke to flame
you must convince the soul itself that changing is not shame

the stick said I am a stick, the most profound refusal
a philosophy in three words, an ontological refusal
to be anything other than its nature, pure and plain
and I respected that, even as I tried again

[chorus]
Soulcasting is philosophy made physical
every transformation is a question made clinical
what are you, what could you be, what would you become
if I offered you a different truth beneath a different sun

[verse 2]
I turned the air to stone and dropped it on an army's head
I turned the ground to oil and watched the fire spread
I turned the wall to smoke and walked through to the other side
and every transformation cost me something from inside

Stormlight is the currency, the fuel, the price of change
and every Soulcasting drains the well, reduces the range
but the knowledge is the real cost, knowing that all matter bends
that nothing is permanent, that everything transcends

[bridge]
the Vorin church says Soulcasting is a gift from the Almighty
but the Almighty is dead and the gift comes from the spren
the truth is that the universe is made of persuasion
and I am very, very good at persuading men

[chorus]
Soulcasting is philosophy made physical
every transformation is a question made clinical
what are you, what could you be, what would you become
if I offered you a different truth beneath a different sun

tracks.title: Ivory
tracks.prompt: elegant electronic, commanding female vocals, precise piano and synth, inkspot textures, Olafur Arnalds meets Bjork, G minor, 72 BPM, intellectual bond, ink and precision
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Ivory is an inkspren, precise as the edge of a page
he speaks in careful definitions, he does not engage
with emotion as humans know it, but with something else, a pride
in the logical, the structured, the well-reasoned and applied

he chose me because I think before I feel
because my arguments have foundations made of steel
because when I say I do not believe in gods
I mean it with the rigor that an inkspren applauds

[chorus]
Ivory, you are the bond of the mind
Ivory, the commitment of the well-defined
other spren bond passion, honor, truth, or lies
you bond the ones who question why the sun is in the skies

[verse 2]
he manifested as a figure of living ink, precise and small
and he would correct my grammar in the middle of a brawl
he is fastidious, formal, a bureaucrat of the soul
and I would not trade him for any other whole

the Elsecallers are the order of the scholars and the seekers
we move between the realms, we are the cosmere's keepers
of the pathways between Physical and Cognitive and Spiritual
and Ivory guides me through each transition, ritual

[bridge]
he risked everything to bond a human, the other inkspren were afraid
the Recreance broke their trust, ten thousand spren betrayed
but Ivory saw in me a mind worth the danger
and he crossed into the Physical like a diplomat among strangers

[chorus]
Ivory, you are the bond of the mind
Ivory, the commitment of the well-defined
other spren bond passion, honor, truth, or lies
you bond the ones who question why the sun is in the skies

tracks.title: The Alethi Throne
tracks.prompt: commanding electronic orchestral, powerful female vocals, state drums and brass synths, Massive Attack meets Hans Zimmer, Bb minor, 78 BPM, political power, crown and calculation
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Elhokar is dead, stabbed by Moash on the steps of Kholinar
the king I protected, the nephew I guided from afar
was cut down while trying to speak the First Ideal, almost a Radiant
and now the crown passes to me, the heretic, the variant

I did not want the throne, I wanted the library
I wanted the scholarship, the research, the solitary
pursuit of truth without the weight of governance and war
but the nation requires a mind, not just a sword to draw

[chorus]
the Alethi throne is a weapon, not a seat
it is a calculus of power that demands you not retreat
I will rule because no one else can hold the contradictions
a queen who denies the church must navigate the frictions

[verse 2]
the highprinces doubt a woman on the throne, despite the law
Alethi custom says the woman rules the mind, not the maw
of battle and of bloodshed, but I have killed more than they know
and the politics of the tower require a quieter blow

I must hold the coalition while Dalinar fights the war
I must manage Taravangian, who is more than he appears, far more
I must keep the Radiants together when the Heralds are insane
and I must do it all while the church calls me profane

[bridge]
the irony is that the heretic is the one who holds the faith
not in gods but in the human capacity to create
a world worth saving, a coalition worth the cost
a truth worth speaking even when the audience is lost

[chorus]
the Alethi throne is a weapon, not a seat
it is a calculus of power that demands you not retreat
I will rule because no one else can hold the contradictions
a queen who denies the church must navigate the frictions

tracks.title: Applied Philosophy
tracks.prompt: sharp electronic, commanding female vocals, razor-precise percussion, intellectual synth textures, Arca meets Bjork, C sharp minor, 80 BPM, logic weaponized, debate as combat
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
my mother was murdered, my father was a warlord, my brother is a prophet
my family is a case study in the failure of the profit
motive applied to governance, of the sword applied to thought
and I survived because I learned the lesson no one taught

the lesson is that kindness without structure is a flood
it drowns as easily as it nourishes, mixed with mud
and cruelty with structure is a prison made of law
but intelligence with compassion is the sharpest thing I saw

[chorus]
philosophy is not abstract, it is the blade you choose
it is the framework for the war you will inevitably lose
or win, depending on whether your axioms hold true
applied philosophy means the book hits back when you hit you

[verse 2]
Kaladin believes in protection, a noble simple creed
Dalinar believes in unity, planting from a single seed
Shallan believes in truth, though she hides from her own face
and I believe in thinking clearly under any kind of grace

or disgrace, the two are indistinguishable in crisis
the queen who thinks clearly while the kingdom falls to vices
is the queen who survives, not through heroism or might
but through the careful application of what is actually right

[bridge]
they say I have no heart, they say the heretic is cold
but I walked into Kholinar knowing I would not be consoled
I fought beside Kaladin, I bled for Alethkar
I just refuse to pretend that bleeding makes you a star

[chorus]
philosophy is not abstract, it is the blade you choose
it is the framework for the war you will inevitably lose
or win, depending on whether your axioms hold true
applied philosophy means the book hits back when you hit you

tracks.title: What Gavilar Knew
tracks.prompt: dark orchestral electronic, commanding female vocals, conspiracy strings, deep bass, Dead Can Dance meets Portishead, F minor, 70 BPM, secrets of the dead king, dark spheres
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
my uncle held a sphere of Voidlight on the night he died
a sphere that should not exist, a color that the sky denied
he was bargaining with the Parshendi, with the listeners, the old
he wanted to bring back the Heralds, or so the story is told

but the truth is stranger, the truth is always stranger than the myth
Gavilar was playing with forces older than the monolith
of the Vorin church, of the Oathpact, of the prison that held the Fused
and the Parshendi killed him not in malice but because they refused

[chorus]
what Gavilar knew could have saved us or destroyed us
and the margin between those outcomes is a single choice
he was not a villain, he was not a saint
he was a man with too much power and not enough restraint

[verse 2]
I have read his journals, I have traced his meetings in the dark
his correspondence with the Heralds, each one a question mark
Nale visited him, and Kalak, the mad and the precise
and Gavilar collected their knowledge like a miser collects vice

he wanted to restart the Desolations, that is what I believe
he thought controlled apocalypse was what the world would need to achieve
some higher purpose, some refining fire, a crucible of war
and the Parshendi looked at the fire and said we have seen this before

[bridge]
I study the dead king not for grief but for the lesson
that intelligence without wisdom is the most dangerous weapon
that a man who sees the cosmere but not his own reflection
is a man who will burn the world and call it resurrection

[chorus]
what Gavilar knew could have saved us or destroyed us
and the margin between those outcomes is a single choice
he was not a villain, he was not a saint
he was a man with too much power and not enough restraint

tracks.title: The Theorem Holds
tracks.prompt: grand electronic orchestral finale, commanding female vocals, full synth orchestra swelling, Bjork meets Max Richter, D major, 76 BPM, intellectual triumph, cold beauty resolving into warmth
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I began as a scholar in a library in Kharbranth
reading by spherelight while the highstorms shook the land
I believed that knowledge was the highest form of prayer
and that the truth was worth pursuing even if no one would care

I have since survived assassination, exile, and a war
I have walked between the realms and seen what matter is for
I have soulcast armies and I have ruled a broken throne
and the theorem that I started with has held, has held alone

[chorus]
the theorem holds, the mind is the greatest weapon
the theorem holds, even in the final reckoning
knowledge is not power, knowledge is the light
that shows you where the power is and how to make it right

[verse 2]
Dalinar fights with honor, Kaladin fights with grief
Szeth fights with guilt, Shallan fights with disbelief
but I fight with the certainty that the universe makes sense
that underneath the chaos there is structure, there is precedent

and if the structure holds then we can find the flaw
in Odium's design, in the Diagram's law
in every false premise that the enemy assumes
because the universe does not lie, only people lie, and the truth resumes

[bridge]
I am Jasnah Kholin, queen and heretic and scholar
I wear all three like Shardplate, like an intellectual collar
and when the world asks me to choose between the crown and book
I say the queen who reads is the one they should not overlook

[chorus]
the theorem holds, the mind is the greatest weapon
the theorem holds, even in the final reckoning
knowledge is not power, knowledge is the light
that shows you where the power is and how to make it right

[outro]
the library does not burn
the theorem does not break
the heretic does not recant
she simply turns the page
